Uses of Class
com.github.robtimus.servlet.parameters.StringParameter

  • Packages that use StringParameter 
    Package Description
    com.github.robtimus.servlet.parameters
    Provides classes and interfaces for working with init and request parameters.

    • Uses of StringParameter in com.github.robtimus.servlet.parameters

      Methods in com.github.robtimus.servlet.parameters that return StringParameter 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StringParameter StringParameter.atLeast(String minValue)
      Validates that the parameter value is not too small.
      StringParameter StringParameter.atMost(String maxValue)
      Validates that the parameter value is not too large.
      StringParameter StringParameter.between(String minValue, String maxValue)
      Validates that the parameter value is not too small or large.
      StringParameter StringParameter.greaterThan(String minValue)
      Validates that the parameter value is not too small.
      StringParameter StringParameter.matching(Pattern pattern)
      Validates that the parameter value matches a pattern.
      StringParameter StringParameter.notBlank()
      Validates that the parameter value is not blank.
      StringParameter StringParameter.notEmpty()
      Validates that the parameter value is not empty.
      static StringParameter StringParameter.of(FilterConfig config, String name)
      Returns a string init parameter for a filter.
      static StringParameter StringParameter.of(ServletConfig config, String name)
      Returns a string init parameter for a servlet.
      static StringParameter StringParameter.of(ServletContext context, String name)
      Returns a string init parameter for a servlet context.
      static StringParameter StringParameter.of(ServletRequest request, String name)
      Returns a string parameter for a servlet request.
      StringParameter StringParameter.smallerThan(String maxValue)
      Validates that the parameter value is not too large.
      StringParameter StringParameter.transform(Function<? super String,String> f)
      Applies a function to the parameter value.
